page.title: 01THE AREA.
page.content: This block is in a rural area.It is rolling countryside with a ridge of high ground running through the centre from The Warren in the north to the Suckley Hills in the south.The hills are densely wooded,mostly with broad leaf trees, though there are a few stands of conifers and areas of mixed woodland. Suckley Green is in the N.W.and consists of isolated houses and farms. The village of Alfrick is in the E.and is a large community with Alfrick Pound to the south. Alfrick is an isolated village.There is only a limited bus service-four times daily Monday-Saturday with no buses on Sunday.The village school closed two years ago,so children travel to Suckley on the school bus. There is one shop/post office and one public house.
